title: Intuitionistic logic
content: Intuitionistic (constructive) logic is similar to classical logic with the notable omission of ~ ax-3 and theorems such as ~ exmid or ~ peirce . We mostly treat intuitionistic logic in a separate file, iset.mm, which is known as the Intuitionistic Logic Explorer on the web site. However, iset.mm has a number of additional axioms (mainly to replace definitions like ~ df-or and ~ df-ex which are not valid in intuitionistic logic) and we want to prove those axioms here to demonstrate that adding those axioms in iset.mm does not make iset.mm any less consistent than set.mm. The following axioms are unchanged between set.mm and iset.mm: ~ ax-1 , ~ ax-2 , ~ ax-mp , ~ ax-4 , ~ ax-11 , ~ ax-gen , ~ ax-7 , ~ ax-12 , ~ ax-8 , ~ ax-9 , and ~ ax-5 . In this list of axioms, the ones that repeat earlier theorems are marked "(New usage is discouraged.)" so that the earlier theorems will be used consistently in other proofs.

blocks.name: axia1
blocks.content: Left 'and' elimination (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-ia1). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 21-May-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axia2
blocks.content: Right 'and' elimination (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-ia2). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 21-May-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axia3
blocks.content: 'And' introduction (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-ia3). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 21-May-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axin1
blocks.content: 'Not' introduction (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-in1). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 21-May-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axin2
blocks.content: 'Not' elimination (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-in2). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 21-May-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axio
blocks.content: Definition of 'or' (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-io). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 21-May-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axi4
blocks.content: Specialization (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-4). This is just ~ sp by another name. (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axi5r
blocks.content: Converse of ~ axc4 (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-i5r). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.)

blocks.name: axial
blocks.content: The setvar ` x ` is not free in ` A. x ph ` (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-ial). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axie1
blocks.content: The setvar ` x ` is not free in ` E. x ph ` (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-ie1). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axie2
blocks.content: A key property of existential quantification (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-ie2). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.)

blocks.name: axi9
blocks.content: Axiom of existence (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-i9). In classical logic, this is equivalent to ~ ax-6 but in intuitionistic logic it needs to be stated using the existential quantifier. (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axi10
blocks.content: Axiom of Quantifier Substitution (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-10). This is just ~ axc11n by another name. (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axi12
blocks.content: Axiom of Quantifier Introduction (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-i12). In classical logic, this is mostly a restatement of ~ axc9 (with one additional quantifier). But in intuitionistic logic, changing the negations and implications to disjunctions makes it stronger. (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.) Avoid ~ ax-11 . (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 24-Apr-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm axi12(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
} = {
  mpbi(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))), wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  mpgbi(s0, wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))), wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  19.32(s0, wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  nfor(s0, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  nfa1(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  nfa1(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))
  mpbir(wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  orri(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  orrd(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  axc9(s0, s1, s2)
  orass(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  orass(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
}

blocks.name: axi12OLD
blocks.content: Obsolete version of ~ axi12 as of 24-Apr-2023. (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Dec-2017.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm axi12OLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
} = {
  mpbi(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))), wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  mpgbi(s0, wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))), wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  19.32(s0, wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  nfor(s0, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  nfae(s0, s0, s1)
  nfae(s0, s0, s2)
  mpbir(wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  orri(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  orrd(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  axc9(s0, s1, s2)
  orass(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  orass(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
}

blocks.name: axbnd
blocks.content: Axiom of Bundling (intuitionistic logic axiom ax-bnd). In classical logic, this and ~ axi12 are fairly straightforward consequences of ~ axc9 . But in intuitionistic logic, it is not easy to add the extra ` A. x ` to ~ axi12 and so we treat the two as separate axioms. (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 22-Mar-2018.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 24-Apr-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm axbnd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))))
} = {
  mpgbi(s1, wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))), wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  bitri(wal(s1, wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))), wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))))
  19.32(s1, wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  nfor(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  nfae(s1, s0, s1)
  nfae(s1, s0, s2)
  orass(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  mpbir(wo(wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))))
  axi12(s0, s1, s2)
  orass(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
}

blocks.name: axbndOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete version of ~ axbnd as of 24-Apr-2023. (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 22-Mar-2018.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm axbndOLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))))
} = {
  orri(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))))
  orrd(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  ex(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  alrimi(s1, wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  nfan(s1, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))
  nfnae(s1, s0, s1)
  nfnae(s1, s0, s2)
  alrimi(s0, wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  nfan(s0, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))
  nfnae(s0, s0, s1)
  nfnae(s0, s0, s2)
  imp(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  axc9(s0, s1, s2)
}
